Translation of 楚竹書・景公疥(en) into English.

p.seg: Duke Jing of Qi had scabies and fever,
a year passed and it did not stop.
Hui Qian and Liang Qiuju told the Duke:
“Our (offerings of) silk are much more beautiful
than the provisions of the former lords,
our (offerings of) precious jades are much larger
than the [...] of the former lords.
[...] the Duke has been having scabies and fever,
a year has passed and they haven’t stopped,
therefore we deem Zhu and Shi to be no good.
We want to execute them.”
The duke raised his head and replied:
“If this is the case, this is what I want from you,
so execute them.”
The two were going to [...]
[...] these words.
Gaozi and Guozi replied:
“[even if] they were close to us,
how could we grudge (their death)?
Since we truly deem Zhu and Shi to have been no good,
the Duke should then execute them.”
Yanzi had an evening audience (with the duke),
while the two daifu left.
The Duke let Yanzi in and told him that
[國子] [...] which he had told Gaozi [and Guozi] [...]
[...] Qu Mu had accomplishments in Song,
the king ordered him
to ask about Fan Wuzi’s actions there.
Wenzi replied:
“I have sent my private envoy
to hear a case (that he adjudicated) in Jin,
he approached the case without recklessness,
sending his private dependants Zhu and Shi to enter [...]
[...] [someone who] accumulates wisdom,
not discarding anyone inside and outside the court,
can be relied upon by the people,
as for the prayers and exorcisms (?) made for their ruler by Zhu and Shi,
truly speaking [...]
[...] [even though Zhu and Shi made prayers and] exorcisms (in favor of their) ruler,
if they do not set out the case [=talk openly]
and have [the duke to] admit his guilt [which is the reason he got his illness],
then their words are not heard
and the case is not won.
If they make their words compliant (to the duke)
and conceal the ugliness [of his sin],
then they fear that later they will be executed [blamed] by the historians.
Therefore the praying for him by Zhu and Shi by means of the divinatory breaking of bamboo [?],
is mainly through ineffective words (?) [...]
[...] make virtue shine and examine actions,
it is because of sending down (ghostly) creatures and evil influences,
it is not because of beautiful jades and sacrificial animals.
Now as a favourite in the court there is Hui Qian,
outside the court there is Liang Qiuju,
their dealings are wild.
The duke causes Wufu to retire
and dislikes sages,
he spreads excesses and causes sincerity to be hidden,
makes [...]
[...] is already lost,
and exalts what is pure to obtain the myriad blessings.
Now the ruler is greedy and muddle headed,
tyrannical and evil,
wrong and unreasonable [...]
[...] If the curse is without damage,
the prayer is also without advantage.
Now the firewood of the mares (??),
he let the Yu (??) guard it;
marshes and bridges,
he let the Mu (??) guard them;
the hills and forests,
he lets the Heng (??) guard them [=all the above are instances of abusive controls?].
All the states are sealed (?),
the entry gates are shut down,
the markets are tightly controlled.
The masses [...]
The ones at your left and right all exult and congratulate each other saying:
“So he must die,
let’s steal to our pleasure.
So the time of death will come
and how humanity [...] [=your tiranny cauuses everyone to wish for your death]
Therefore inside the court the favorite concubines
oppressively extract (goods) from the country,
outside the court the favorite ministers
forge (orders) at the borders.
From Gu and You to the West,
and from Liao and She to the East,
there are many people [=under the Duke],
and these (people) are all poor and suffering, straightened and sick,
husbands and wives all curse (you);
even if one adult male [one of your officials] holds a measure of silk,
three measures (?) of jade [to pray for you],
even if these fellows [...]
why these two fellows did not receive the kingly xx,
I have not yet heard about it.
[...] The Duke rose up with strength,
he left the mat and said:
“My good master!”
Yanzi (said):
“These are the words of (dukes) Xiang and Huan!”
“Sacrifices and prognostications did not manage to dispel the evil influence,
and so (the situation) has reached this point.
The spirits saw my excess and violence
[...] ask for sacrifices and prognostications.”
